summary: Jeremy Ray Akers is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll certifications from February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. The documents list Akers' name and salary, indicating his role as a staff member during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications confirm that Akers was employed by the committee and received compensation for his work during the specified periods.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Jeremy Ray Akers' significance lies in his employment as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination, as evidenced by his inclusion in the committee's payroll records.
